    • Method Detail

      • d

        public static int d​(int sides)
        A man in Bangladesh rolls a dice with the specified number of sides and returns the result to this method, which returns it to the caller. His name is Rajesh, be nice to Rajesh.
        Parameters:
        sides - the number of sides for the dice (i.e, the upper bound of the result, exclusive)
        Returns:
        an integer between 0 and sides

      • d

        public static int d​(int sides,
                    int numDice)
        Performs d(sides) exactly numDice times, and returns the total
        Parameters:
        sides - the number of sides for the dice (i.e, the upper bound of each roll result, exclusive)
        numDice - the number of (sides)-sided dice to roll and sum
        Returns:
        the sum of the dice rolls

      • p

        public static boolean p​(int percent)
        Like a coin flip, but the likelihood of the result can be specified. Rolls a d100, and if the result is less than percent, returns true (hence 'p', for percentile)
        Parameters:
        percent - the likelihood, in percentage, of a true result being returned
        Returns:
        true or false

      • coin

        public static boolean coin()
        Flips a coin and returns the result
        Returns:
        true if the coin flip passes, false if not

      • getMonoFontFamilyNames

        private static com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<java.lang.String> getMonoFontFamilyNames()
        Return a list of all the mono-spaced fonts on the system. https://yo-dave.com/2015/07/27/finding-mono-spaced-fonts-in-javafx/
        Returns:
        A list of all of the mono-spaced fonts on the system.
